channel.title: CV on Emil Bakkensen Johansen
channel.description: Recent content in CV on Emil Bakkensen Johansen

item.title: MSc in Sociology, University of Copenhagen
item.description: Specialization in Knowledge, Organization and Politics. GPA: 11.3. Grade 12 (A) for final master’s thesis: “Non-human actants on the frontlines of #Hongkong. A digital sociological paper about the Anti-ELAB movement and its symbol construction on Twitter." Scraping of 1.6 million tweets about the protests Dictionary classification (machine learning) Object detection in 700,000 images (YOLOv4) Network analysis (Gephi) Actor-network theory Python coding Selection of courses completed: Digital Methods: From Facebook Ethnography to Computational Social Science Governed by Algorithms - Facebook, Google, and the re-programming of digital citizens Democratic Innovations and Civic Participation Problematization Analysis: How and Why something is and became a Social Problem Here is my master’s degree certificate.

item.title: VIVE - The Danish Center for Social Science Research
item.description: I was employed at VIVE from August 2019 to June 2021 as a Student Assistant. My tasks as student assistant was to assist on multiple projects within different welfare sectors. I collected qualitative/ quantitative data, coded in STATA, screened literature and co-authored reports. The scope of the projects I worked on ranged from (but was not limited to): Children homicide committed by parents Relatives to people experiencing domestic violence Assessment of citizens with a combination of mental health sickness and substance abuse Read report about the subject that I co-authored here (in Danish) Voluntary support interventions for at-risk families Read report about the subject that I co-authored here (in Danish) Sugardating among Danish youth Family law

item.title: BSc in Sociology, University of Copenhagen
item.description: GPA: 9.0 Grade 10 (B) for my bachelor’s thesis: “You wouldn’t steal a car: a sociological study of online piracy” Qualitative interviews with online pirates Symbolic interactionism Neutralization techniques Consumption and identity Selection of courses completed: Political Sociology Advanced Quantitative Methods Advanced Qualitative Methods Race/Gender/Surveillance Globalization and Social Media Here is my bachelor’s degree certificate.

item.title: Exchange at The University of Texas at Austin
item.description: I spent the Fall semester of 2017 as an exchange student in Austin, Texas. Here, I studied media, intersectionality and surveillance, while improving my English proficiencies. Courses completed: Race/Gender/Surveillance Globalization and Social Media Sociological Theory Sociology of Criminal Justice

item.title: The National Board of Social Services (Socialstyrelsen)
item.description: At The National Board of Social Services I was employed from February 2018 to July 2019 as a Student Assistant. I was part of a team that focused on youth at risk and assisted with planning events for service practitioners, set up surveys and gained experience with the Danish state apparatus. Furthermore, I updated the webpages for different projects and assisted in case management for Danish government funds (Satspuljen). Here is a selection of projects I assisted on:

item.title: Danske Bank
item.description: I was employed at Danske Bank as an IT Supporter from March 2015 to June 2015. From Danske Bank headquarters I was an IT Supporter for the bank’s MobilePay service, assisting customers with difficulties via phone.
